climbs.name: Warm up that kills your hands

content.description: Fun and pretty easy warm up area next to hand killer. Easy ish jugs and crimps, as well as some slopers
content.location: On the main boulder next to hand killer

content.description: Ow. Your hands will be bleeding after this route if you aren’t prepared. Mostly slopers other than a few key crimps and jugs. The rock is so grippy and coarse that it almost hurts to climb it. On the bright side your hands stick to the rock especially in the cold. Basically any surface feels like it’s grabbing you. You start with your feet on the overhung bottom, and your hands on a crimp and a slug (slopey jug) from there use the abundant amount of small jugs and slopes to get your way towards the top where you’ll meet some finger pockets. That’s what gives it a v1-2 grade marked by x’s 3 and 4 there’s a jug and dug in crimp. Then work your way up to a main finger pocket, get your feet on the jug, and drop your knee into a higher finger pocket of your choice. Then you’ll get to the topout which is the easiest part of the climb
content.protection: A crash pad, spotter, and helmet
content.location: Main stack, tower to the right

content.description: You start on the underside of the rock on two slopers and do a mini dyno into a sideways crimp. From there ascend using slopers and knobs till you get to an indent in the wall that’s a very deep rail crimp counterpressure it then match your feet onto the lower part of the indent and use it as an undercling. Drop your right knees, and fall into a finger pocket and it’s sent!
content.location: On main stack to the right
